oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Eads Rosenwald School: view of the main building
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of one section of a one-story brick school complex. This principal red brick building with a green cross hipped roof was originally built in the 1920's, but several further additions were made over time. The principal building features a small front gable porch roof. It is flanked by two six-over-six light double hung windows on one side and three similar windows on the other side. The other three entrances each feature a flat porch roof with stairs leading up to a pair of white doors.

The Eads School was built with support of the Julius Rosenwald fund. Most of the additions to the property were completed in 1953. The elementary school was used as a clinic for a short period of time, but it was later completely abandoned. In 2015, the building was scheduled for demolition.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Julius Rosenwald Fund -- Buildings; African American schools -- Tennessee
